choices: A few weeks later, Aphrodite's indulgences are beginning to show...
She's awoken by a shocked Hephaestus returning home
114.content:
Aphrodite was sulking.
She - the literal the goddess of beauty - couldn't win a Styx-damned beauty contest! It was absurd. Oh sure, she'd won in the end - but only by bribing the judge! Paris simply hadn't been able to decide which of she, Hera and Athene was the most beautiful, and she knew his judgement was fair.

Seriously - what was the point of being the divine patron of love and beauty if she wasn't even the prettiest goddess on Olympus? It was unfair, and unreasonable, and, and... and probably even some other words too that she couldn't think of. Bitterly, she grabbed a cup of nectar and downed it, the sweet drink flowing smoothly down her throat. The sugary taste did something to counteract the bitterness in her belly, so she broke the habit of an immortal lifetime and had another cup. Normally she wouldn't dare - nectar, whilst unimaginably delicious, was also notoriously fattening - but today she couldn't care less. What was even the point of obsessing over her weight if even Hera was apparently just as beautiful as she was? What was the point of trying if she couldn't be the best?

She lay back on her bed, sighing wistfully as she took a gulp from the second cup of nectar. Before she knew it, the cup was empty and she was refilling it again from the jug - then she frowned. Why even bother with the cup? She tossed it aside irritably and grabbed the jug, pouring the sweet nectar straight down her throat. Who cared if it was indecorous? This was her house, this was her nectar, and she was upset. Why not treat herself?
The nectar slid silkily down her throat and into her belly, the delightful sweetness tantalising her tastebuds. She'd drunk nectar before, of course - every day of her immortal life, in fact - but somehow it tasted better today. She tipped the jug higher to increase the flow, chugging it as quickly as she could; still not quickly enough though as a fair quantity spilled out of her mouth, splashing down her bare chest and swelling stomach.

Before she knew it the jug was empty, and she flung it aside just to hear it smash. Her stomach was churning, unused to this quantity of rich liquid all at once, and looking down she saw that it was visibly swollen. She put a hand on it, groaning as she suddenly realised just how full she was. Drinking all that nectar had probably been a mistake, but she couldn't bring herself to care. She'd spent an eternity holding back, and now she was sick of it. Dieting could go to Hades - she was going to indulge, and nobody could stop her.

She slid off her bed and padded to her storeroom. Here, she knew, Hephaestus stored all sorts of delicacies - she only wanted one thing though. Bending down, she searched through the cases until she found what she was looking for; a two dozen cakes baked with ambrosia. She took them in her arms and returned to her bed, depositing them in a heap on the covers. Her husband had been saving these for a special occasion, but she hadn't so much as seen him in weeks, so busy he was with his incessant forging, so he wasn't likely to notice any time soon.
Without a delay she unwrapped one of the little cakes and shoved it whole into her mouth. Delicious! Truly delicious!
At once she grabbed another cake, then another, gulping them down impressive haste. Crumbs scattered her bedclothes and her body, sticking patchily to the nectar still on her belly and breasts as she continued to gulp down the cakes, ignoring the building discomfort in her gut, too lost in the divine taste to worry.
Before she knew it, all the cakes were gone. Her hand found nothing but bare wood inside the box, and she snapped out of her food-trance with a jerk - o-ouch! Shards of pain shot through her agonisingly full stomach, and she groaned as she collapsed into fetal position on the bed, clutching at her bloated gut with both hands. It was so swollen that she looked pregnant, filled with more than enough food to kill a mortal - fortunately for Aphrodite she was divine, and thus couldn't be killed - by overindulgence or anything else - and so she just fell promptly into a deep sleep, moaning aloud with discomfort every time her stomach grumbled and churned, yet unable to bring herself to regret her oversized feast.
114.title: Goddess of Love, Beauty and Bad Decisions

choices: The following day, Hephaestus finally returns home
A meeting of the council is called, and Aphrodite must attend
More months pass, as Aphrodite's consumption grows ever greater
1142.content:
The speed with which Aphrodite fell into a habit of overindulgence was almost alarming. Over the course of less than a week, the good habits forged over aeons were undone, replaced by increasingly overblown indulgences. Not caring for discomfort or the inevitable impact on her waistline, she began to drink nectar as though it were water, as well as feasting on ambrosia in increasingly vast amounts. Every morning she'd treat herself with a veritable feast of ambrosia, and every evening she'd eat until she passed out.

The effects of this self-destructive lifestyle quickly became evident. The goddess had never been extremely skinny - she'd always been thoroughly curvy, a very paragon of femininity - but in only a few weeks her body thickened and softened until she was decidedly plump. Her thighs thickened until they brushed together as she trotted hourly to the store cupboard for more snacks; her hips widened, forming a seamless exaggerated curve with her newly chunky hips; her already-round rear swelled even plumper, only remaining so astonishingly pert through some godly enchantment; her breasts became fuller than ever; even her fair limbs thickened slightly, the first hints of flab softening her upper arms.

The worst damaged of all, however, was inevitably her stomach. A thick pad of fat had found its way there, clinging to her midsection and rounding it into a chunky potbelly that quivered subtly as she moved. Her figure, from the moment she emerged from the ocean sea-foam, had always been utterly perfect - now, however, it was glaringly flawed, and that softly sagging potbelly was the most undeniable demonstration of those new flaws.

Despite all of this, however, Aphrodite remained almost entirely oblivious, too lost in her sulking and indulgences to consider her mirror for even a moment. As she spent almost all her time nude, as was her custom, she didn't have any clothes to wrestle with, any buttons to burst - she just got up in the morning, stretched, and returned to the feasting as though she had never even paused. She didn't even bother to tie her hair up anymore - it just hung down loose around her shoulders, scraggly from the weeks of remaining unwashed and uncombed.

It was on one of the many indistinguishable days of feasting and eating that finally Aphrodite found herself interrupted from her indulgent solitude by a tap-tap-rapping on the door. She knew the knock to be that of Ares, her lover, and excitedly she slipped off her bed, wrapped a piece of drapery casually around herself so as to somewhat preserve her modesty, and hurried at once to let him in.
As he stepped inside though and set eyes upon her, his permanent smirk of self-satisfaction quivered. His eyes raked over the soft curves of her body, so much more drastic than he remembered, before eventually settling on her stomach, swollen even more than usual from a morning of incessant feasting.

"What is this?" he asked, a dark scowl crossing his face, "I know I should not expect fidelity from you, but this is an insult nonetheless! I know you sleep not with Hephaestus, so you must bear the child of yet another lover. So be it! If whore you wish to be, then whore I shall leave you!"
"W-wait!" Aphrodite stammered, grasping his arm in dismay as he turned to leave, "What do you mean? I bear no child! You are my only lover, I promise you."
She let the drapery fall to the floor, revealing her body in its entirety. She was used to this earning her any favour from any man, but Ares' scowl just deepened.
"Then you be a glutton!" he exclaimed, lip curling, "You look as a sacrificial heifer, eyes wide and confused as it is led to the altar, unknowing of its fate; its body is swollen from the years of fattening, all for this purpose, yet is ignorant. Such is the appearance which you have adopted."
With this he jerked his arm back, and Aphrodite fell to the floor with a cry. The door slammed as Ares left, leaving her to sob disconsolately on the tiled flooring of her husband's great house.

After only a few minutes of crying pathetically on the floor, Aphrodite's stomach began to rumble. It was used now to being fed nigh-constantly, and the delay in the feeding was causing to complain bitterly. Miserably, Aphrodite complied with its request, and that afternoon and night she glutted herself beyond any gorging she had attempted before. Lying prone on her bed, tears staining the sheets, she consumed jug after jug of nectar, as well as entire cases of ambrosia. Eventually, belly distended and gurgling, the discomfort of her immense consumption finally overwhelmed her and she fell asleep with a jug of nectar still in her hand, dripping its contents onto the already-stained bedclothes.
1142.title: Consequences

11422.content:
For many months, Aphrodite lived like this. Engorged on ambrosia and nectar, she began to grow more and more womanly by the day. Her hips and thighs grew soft and as pillowy as the finest fleece, her derrière taking on the animated and liquid movements of jello with every lethargic step she took. Her stomach’s tan Mediterranean skin had grown slightly pale as it’s comfy girth extended and stretched everyday. For many months, Aphrodite had lived like this. Her peaceful and content feast, however, had to come to an end eventually.
         With feet as light as the wind upon which he ran, Hermes found himself in the living room of Aphrodite’s home, but where was Aphrodite? A council of the gods was a grave necessity, for Prometheus had stolen the fires of creation, and given them to man. Prometheus was to be punished, no doubt Zeus could handle that well enough, but was to become of the human race? For a decision so important, all hands were needed on deck, including Aphrodite.
         Hermes needn’t wait long to find the missing goddess, he just had to follow the trail of soft moans, sweet as the nectar which Aphrodite bathed in. When Hermes found her, he was shocked to see a rubenesque and lethargic beauty drenched in sticky sweets. Though completely naked of clothes, even her face wore a warm coat of fat blubber, giving a softened chin which partially gave way to another.
         Hermes, though shocked, had no times for comments, for they were soon needed in Olympus to decide the fate of man. Aphrodite was lethargic to get up, and even more so in putting on clothes, much to Hermes ire. She found her toga
11422.title: A meeting of the council is called, and Aphrodi...

choices: Hades intends to fatten Persephone up
Persephone develops a love of feasts
115.content:
Persephone, daughter of the harvest goddess Demeter, now stared at her dismal environment. Accustomed to green fields brimming with vegetation, the dark lifeless realm of the underworld invoked a soul crushing dejection in the goddess. The reason for her new life is Hades, ruler of the underworld, had abducted her as his bride. Now unwillingly attaining the role of empress of underworld, Persephone sat upon her throne next to Hades.

"I assure you, Persephone that I'll make sure that you'll enjoy your new home." Hades spoke. "It's just not the same." Persephone sniffled. "I know but I intend to bring elation to your life through revelry and hedonism." Hades said with a devious grimace. Suddenly an elaborate feast was brought before Persephone. "Oh why this is really impressive." Persephone admitted as she gazed upon the decadent piles of food standing before her. "Please partake of my riches, my beautiful queen. Eat to your heart's desire." Hades encouraged. Persephone modestly took a taste before Hades goaded her into a more indulgent gorge. "Please don't be so shy! I'm the king of the underworld, I can give you so much." prided the underworld ruler.
115.title: persephone

12.content:
Medusa- The hideous monster who turns people to stone

Siren- A monster who sings to sailors leading them to their death.

Harpy: A monster who spoils food for the people it encounters.
12.title: Monster

122.content:
First of all, what kind of siren?

Woman with bird wings.
Mermaid.
122.title: Siren

1221.content: Recently, more and more boats have been sailing around the Siren's lair. That means more victims of the Siren's song, which means more food. Because of this, the once beautiful Siren had grown quite plump. She could no longer fly, and either hopped or waddled from one corpse to another. This bounty was almost too much for the Siren. She tried and tried, but she could never eat all of the flesh.
1221.title: Bird-woman

1222.content:
"All hands on Deck!" shouted the ship's captain. crossing the Aegean sea. "We must sail quickly through this area." urged the nervous captain. The captain was not worried about any sea serpents but rather the alluring melody of the legendary sirens. No man could resist the siren call. No one knew what they looked like for no one ever returned. All sailors had was the myth, that the sirens were beautiful women who lived in a cavern in the sea and entice men to follow their echoing song to their death. Unfortunately the captain made a miscalculation and ended up being directly in range of the siren's call. "Oh no what's that?" cried out the captain. "GASP Quickly boys cover your ears---ah what a beautiful song." said the captain who along with his men fell victim to the enchanting melody. "Follow the song men." urged the bewitched captain.

They arrived at the siren's cavern were they caught sight of the legendary creatures. The sirens were in fact beautiful women with mermaid bodies, long enticing hair, flawless faces, large breasts, smooth skin, and obviously soothing voices. The enamored men jovially hopped off the ship and swam into the sirens' open arms. As the men embraced the sirens the sirens then began to eat the hapless sailors, who despite being devoured remained utterly captivated. The sirens continued to feast until all that remained was the captain. The sirens approach the unresponsive captain and....
1222.title: Mermaid

124.content:
The cyclopes and the minotaur were generally assumed to be male, but there is no reason why there cannot be female versions.

Surely there were cyclops women, even though the stories did not mention them. Their capacity to eat would be greater than that of a normal human.

And there was nothing stopping the minotaur of Crete from breeding with any of the women sent to him as a sacrifice. Theseus killed King Minos's pet minotaur, but there may have been offspring left behind. For the sake of this story we can assume that at least one creature survived with the head of a cow and the body of a formidable woman.
124.title: Other

1243.content:
How about the centaur. Hera had sex with the king Ixion and give birth to a monster part horse part human. The body of a horse wit the upper body of a man. known like heavy drinkers and womanizers. Most stories are about male centaurs but I don't see a reason why there would't be any female centaurs.

There's also the sphinx.
I know you're all gonna say the sphinx is't from Greece, it's from Egypt. Wrong. Egypt does has a sphinx but the Greek also have their own sphinx who's a bit different. A female sphinx who's cruel and bloodthirsty with the body of a lion, wings and the head (and big boobs) of a woman. The skin, fur and wings all have the color of gold. But just like the Egypt sphinx she asks riddles, and if you don't know the answer she devours you.

So the centaur or the sphinx. Or can you still think of another Greek monster?
1243.title: The centaur and the sphinx

12433.content:
Then how about this one

Lamia. A beautiful woman. At least her upper body. From the waist down she has the body of a snake. She used to rule over Libya. She was so beautiful she got the attention from Zeus. He gave her the ability to pull her eyes out and put them back in whenever she liked. She also give birth to several children from Zeus. Hera the wife/sister of Zeus got so angry she killed all kids (except Scylla who she transformed in a huge six headed monster with the body of a huge ten legged dog that grabbed sailors from ships who came to near her). Lamia wanted revenge and decided to harm other woman in the same way. She stole children out of their cribs and devoured them. Her name Lamia comes from the Greek word: "lamyros" what means gluttony. She also sucked the life force out of men she seduced.

Perhaps a famous one. The werewolf.
The werewolf is know over the entire world but the first werewolf came Greece. King Lycaeon was a king who was horrible for his people and ate so much himself he looked like a fat pig. Zeus thought this was so terrible he went down to earth. There he told who he was. But Lycaeon did't believed him and laughed at him. He said that if you're a god I'm king of the wolves. To see if Zeus really was a god he killed his own seven year old son, cooked him and served him to Zeus. When Zeus found out he became so angry he turned Lycaeon in a wolf. A wolf who devoured every living thing he encountered. A blood thirst that kept going on forever. But who knows. He might have some offspring.

Or do you still know another monster?
12433.title: Lamia or the werewolf
